section.title: SM Operator management configuration
section.p: The operator authentication and authorization related details are as follows:

li.p: Authentication: An operator enters a valid username and password in the log in screen to authenticate access to SM. If a user enters an invalid username or password or both, then the user is notified with an error message on the GUI:
The 401 response code indicates that the user authentication details are provided but they failed authorization tests.
When a user receives the authentication error message, the user must check with the administrator for a valid user name and password to access SM.

Authorization: The role assigned to a user authorizes access to the MEs. If a role is not authorized with access to specific objects on the SM GUI, the user is notified with the following error message:
User is not authorized to access the requested resource with 401 response code.
When a user receives the authorization error message, the operator must assign the user with a role that allows access to the required objects on SM.

note.p: For information on how to manage Linux users, see the Operation, Administration and Maintenance Guide.

section.p:
In the top right-hand corner of the configuration page you can activate (Active is default) or deactivate the SM operator using the slide bar (
). The operator needs to be in the active state to be able to log in. The active state is green on the slide bar. The Inactive state is red on the slide bar. The slide bar icon also appears in the SM Operators list of configured SM operators, under State, as either green or red depending on whether the operator is active or Inactive.

Following table describes the parameters configured for an operator:
Parameter
Description
User ID Enter a User ID of at least 6 and no more than 20 lower case characters. Tap the Verify button to check that the ID is available for use.
Password The Password should contain a digit, a lower case letter, an upper case letter, and a special character and it contains between 8 and 15 characters.
Email ID The Email ID is the contact email address of the operator being configured.
User Name The full name of the operator being configured.
Language for Email Template Select the language used in the email template.
Phone Number The contact phone number of the operator being configured. For each operator, you must select the country and enter the phone number.
Role
The role assigned to the operator, which can be one of administrator or any of the roles that you define for the security domains. The role assigned to a user authorizes access to specific operations.
The smadmin User ID is a system-defined ID created at the time of SM installation to be a default operator. By default, the Administrator role is assigned to it. The Administrator role is assigned the system security domain and any user who is assigned this role can access all the features in the SM application. No other operator-defined roles are assigned with the system security domain, which is a reserved keyword.
See Role Management.
Security Domain
A Security Domain (SD) is an ID that contains objects and permissions assigned to each object. Each provisioned object in SM is tagged with a security domain ID. Each SM operator is associated with a set of security domains and within each security domain, the operator is assigned permissions to perform certain actions on specific SM entities.
The Security domain is an ID tag for grouping permissions at the operator level and as a reference at the object level. Each role can be assigned multiple security domains.
State You can move the slide bar to change an operator state. By default, the state is Active and shown by the presence of a green slide bar. If the slide bar is red, the operator is Inactive.
